TopicTitle: Just wondering if anyone has figured out how to...

Articles.Content:
So among some of my streaming exploits this morning I came across a method for controlling 6 kernels(from now on I'm not going to edit this autocorrect "feature") on the ground simultaneously. Direct control. Having their movements all mirror each other.

Before I go and give it away I want to find out if anyone else has figured it out

Do you mean kerbals (wow sorry lol, scumbag autocorrect)? If so, Kerbals are essentially a one part ship, so I guess if you go in your quicksave file and copy the "part" code of five other kerbals into the "ship" of another kerbal they will all move at the same time. Just rapid guessing though.

I was testing my newest Segway design, since my last one didn't have rover seats PLUS got removed from my tracking station for having the old mechjeb spherical probe core on it and the part not liking 0.20.2 without being modified, when I discovered something fun about Seats + Clipping + exiting to the tracking station. Lets see if you can get it from that. If not then in a few hours when I have some time ill post it. It's also saved from my most recent twitch broadcast if you want to see my discovery of it lol. Twitch.tv/hoyin1600p

I'm not 100% positive the recording is up yet since twitch usually emails me when it is done processing, and I haven't gotten the email yet.

It should be in here somewhere but I can't view it from my iPhone

http://www.twitch.tv/hoyin1600p/b/412526548

Edited June 5, 2013 by HoY

And please be warned there may be a very small amount of profanity. I don't recall if there was or not I strive to not. But I get a little frustrated sometimes lol.

(None near the timer I stated but if you decide to watch the whole thing you may come across some)
Kind of surprised nobody thought this was interesting lol
